author: Odeinoichus
title: Eroyl Flynn and Chivalry
review:
Set #71007 Swashbuckler: I feel like this is one of the weaker offerings from Series 12, however it does look fairly impressive and I'm certain many fans will want multiples of that new torso for some MOC characters.

The Swashbuckler has a double-sided torso print with an open frilled shirt showing off a bare chest and a fancy looking cumberbund/belt with a golden star buckle. The hat was used last with the Musketeer if memory serves and the facial print looks like a fancy grey mustache and matching eyebrows.

Overall this is a fairly weak offering as far as a fun character goes for the younger fans, some might have fun using the rapier and fighting against some foes to protect the world or something, however for most collectors the parts are more interesting for MOC minifigure fans. Mildly recommended.

author: sideswinger
title: meh...
review:
Okay, so Series 12 rocks, in my opinion. That may be a hot take, but I really do like this set of 16. However, two figures seem to be on a lower level of quality and detail as others, those being the Lifeguard, who's my least favourite of the series, and unfortunately, the Swashbuckler, who includes 7 pieces. Like the rest of the series, he was released in 2014, where he was part of the first unlicensed series to cost $4 dollars.

Atop the character is an excellent hat piece that was first introduced with the Series 4 Musketeer in 2011, so it's great seeing it return here, and in a new colour, at that. This red-brown tone looks preferable for this piece over the original black tone, and I've always been impressed by the detail in the curved-up side of the hat. A small hole for accessories is present at the back of the hat, and that allows for a red feather quill to peg in. While I think a darker red tone would’ve looked better, this is a fantastic inclusion.

The head print here I suppose is nice. I always like seeing chipper smiles on minifigures, and he has a tan moustache to accent it. Something about this head makes me happy, and I'm not sure what!

His torso has a nice print, however the yellow flesh doesn't perfectly match the colour of his head. I appreciate the red belt with that big ol' golden belt buckle, and surprisingly, that printing carries onto the back, where the red belt is continued. I would have certainly complained if he lacked it, since the figure otherwise lacks detail.

Nothing at the legs, and he only includes one accessory, that being his golden fencing sword. It's caste in perl gold, but it feels like a weak accessory, since the original Musketeer from Series 4 had the same accessory in pearl silver.

Overall, this figure is a remake of the Series 4 Musketeer, and though I don't really love that CMF, this figure is a little bit worse. I like the recolour of that hat piece, but nothing else necessarily stands out for me. I'm gonna give him a 2 out of 5.

Thanks for reading, I hope this was informative and useful!
